section.title: An unexpected realization
section.para:
The Holy Grail of game developing (and usually of software developing) is the quest for ”Killer Apps”
To picture the ”killer app”Killer app concept we could mention the DoomDoom PC game or the Facebook social network site. These apps are rare by their nature, developing a killer appKiller app with an expected realization is impossible. Of course, this would be equally true for an unexpected direction, because killer apps are not developed directly, but an app can become one.

In this case – at least in our research – we can bravely try to ”redeem the world”. For this, let us examine first, why we like playing games and can we develop artificial intelligence with an esport game. In other words, we define artificial intelligence neither as the controlling process of the player nor as the control of the gameplay, but as the creation of a new intelligent lifeform. Now, this is an entirely intuitive goal, so let the lifeform to be created mean anything for now.

section.title: Why do we like playing?
section.para:
Our physical body lives in the ”disordered” molecular world of chemistry, but as a living system it is able to increase and maintain its internal order (in other words, to grow up and to preserve its temporary consistency during its lifetime) in this world.
See Erwin Schrödinger's, What is life? : the physical aspect of the living cell, Cambridge University Press, 1944 and Roger Penrose's, A ​császár új elméje Számítógépek, gondolkodás és a fizika törvényei, Akadémiai, Budapest, 1993. We can assume that this attribute is ”inherited” from our mental functionings in the following meaning: they are able to see the order in the noisy input, perceived by our sensory organs. This is called: reality. Our thesis is that we enjoy playing because we can improve the internal order of the game, inside the game.

I can confirm this thesis or just illustrate it only relying on my subjective experiences and the conversations between me and my children. section.title: Risks
section.para: It goes without saying that the „unexpected” direction is basic research and includes many pitfalls, which could detain the setting and realization of used research goals, not to mention the experimental development that could be built on top of our research.

section.title: Conclusion
section.para: We outlined an esport research plan including the actual Budapest 2024 Budapest 2024 sportdiplomatical efforts, and we dreamed this plan further. In addition, we placed a hard-core artificial intelligence research focus in our basic research direction.
If we succeed in searching resources for the research, it is worth working side by side on both the ”probable” and the ”unexpected” directions.
Without support, only the basic research is recommended.
We will embed our developmental robotics and robotpsychology research into the esport concept outlined in this document.
We will call the „probable” research direction Samu Standard and the „unexpected” direction Samu Entropy
